feed.title: BCD-watch: Changes Report (weekly)
feed.subtitle: A feed that summarizes changes to BCD weekly

entry.title: BCD Changes Report, Mon Nov 25 2024
entry.summary: Weekly summary of new changes in BCD data
entry.content:
Summary of BCD changes from Monday, 18 November 2024 through Monday, 25 November 2024ğŸ”—

Browser Support Changes: +18, -0

Support increases (18)

API

  1. api â DevicePosture
    Added to Chrome  â  1 of 3 engines
  2. api â DevicePosture â change_event
    Added to Chrome  â  1 of 3 engines
  3. api â DevicePosture â type
    Added to Chrome  â  1 of 3 engines
  4. api â Navigator â devicePosture
    Added to Chrome  â  1 of 3 engines
  5. api â PushMessageData â bytes
    Added to Chrome  â  3 of 3 engines
  6. api â Request â bytes
    Added to Chrome  â  3 of 3 engines
  7. api â Response â bytes
    Added to Chrome  â  3 of 3 engines
  8. api â TrustedTypePolicyFactory
    Added to Firefox  â  2 of 3 engines
  9. api â TrustedTypePolicyFactory â getAttributeType
    Added to Firefox  â  2 of 3 engines
  10. api â TrustedTypePolicyFactory â getPropertyType
    Added to Firefox  â  2 of 3 engines
  11. api â HTMLElement â beforetoggle_event â dialog_elements
    Added to Firefox,Chrome  â  2 of 3 engines
  12. api â HTMLElement â toggle_event â dialog_elements
    Added to Firefox,Chrome  â  2 of 3 engines
  13. api â MLOperand â MLNumber
    Added to Chrome  â  1 of 3 engines
  14. api â PublicKeyCredential â signalAllAcceptedCredentials_static
    Added to Chrome  â  1 of 3 engines
  15. api â PublicKeyCredential â signalCurrentUserDetails_static
    Added to Chrome  â  1 of 3 engines
  16. api â PublicKeyCredential â signalUnknownCredential_static
    Added to Chrome  â  1 of 3 engines

CSS

  1. css â properties â writing-mode â sideways-lr
    Added to Chrome  â  2 of 3 engines
  2. css â properties â writing-mode â sideways-rl
    Added to Chrome  â  2 of 3 engines

BCD Metadata Changes: 113

Show all 113 changes

Note: The following represent changes to BCD metadata keys in the reported time period. Keys are not implementations, and they don't represent commitments toward implementation, etc. A new key occurring is perhaps a signal that some implementer was serious enough to add the key. Many of the features that are 'removed' are usually just 'moved' or 'renamed', but we don't have great ways to highlight that.

Backfilled entries (41)

The entries in this section saw support information change since the report on Tuesday, 12 November 2024, but all the supported browser versions given were more than a couple of months old. Typically, these are cases of support information being updated long after the support actually landed in a browser, but nobody ever updated the BCD entry.

JAVASCRIPT

  1. javascript â builtins â Error â cause â displayed_in_console
    Backfilled for Chrome  â  2 of 3 engines

API

  1. api â AbortController â abort â reason_parameter
    Backfilled for Firefox  â  3 of 3 engines
  2. api â DocumentPictureInPicture â requestWindow â option_disallowReturnToOpener
    Backfilled for Chrome  â  1 of 3 engines
  3. api â DocumentPictureInPicture â requestWindow â option_preferInitialWindowPlacement
    Backfilled for Chrome  â  1 of 3 engines
  4. api â GPUCommandEncoder â beginRenderPass â separate_depth_stencil_read-only
    Backfilled for Chrome  â  1 of 3 engines
  5. api â GPUComputePassEncoder â setBindGroup â unset_bind_group
    Backfilled for Chrome  â  1 of 3 engines

    Backfilled for Chrome  â  1 of 3 engines

    Backfilled for Chrome  â  1 of 3 engines

    Backfilled for Chrome  â  1 of 3 engines

HTTP

    Backfilled for Firefox  â  3 of 3 engines

    Backfilled for Firefox  â  3 of 3 engines

WEBEXTENSIONS

  1. webextensions â api â runtime â getContexts
    Backfilled for Firefox  â  2 of 3 engines

New entries (58)

The entries in this section were not found in BCD on Tuesday, 12 November 2024, but are now present. These usually do not have any support information attached to them, and often have no corresponding MDN page. Sometimes, entries that appear here also appear in the next section (â€œRemoved BCD entriesâ€) because of a Working Group deciding on a rename.

API

  1. api â AbortController â abort â reason_parameter

Removed entries (14)

The entries in this section were found in BCD on Tuesday, 12 November 2024, but are no longer present. The reasons for this removal can be anything from an experimental proposal that was never supported to a property or value being renamed to something else.

entry.title: BCD Changes Report, Mon Nov 18 2024
entry.summary: Weekly summary of new changes in BCD data
entry.content:
Summary of BCD changes from Monday, 11 November 2024 through Monday, 18 November 2024ğŸ”—

Browser Support Changes: +5, -0

Support increases (5)

API

  1. api â Window â pagereveal_event
    Added to Safari  â  2 of 3 engines
  2. api â Window â pageswap_event
    Added to Safari  â  2 of 3 engines
  3. api â ServiceWorkerContainer â worker_support
    Added to Firefox  â  2 of 3 engines

CSS

  1. css â at-rules â page
    Added to Safari  â  3 of 3 engines
  2. css â at-rules â page â size
    Added to Safari  â  3 of 3 engines

BCD Metadata Changes: 4

Show all 4 changes

Note: The following represent changes to BCD metadata keys in the reported time period. Keys are not implementations, and they don't represent commitments toward implementation, etc. A new key occurring is perhaps a signal that some implementer was serious enough to add the key. Many of the features that are 'removed' are usually just 'moved' or 'renamed', but we don't have great ways to highlight that.

New entries (1)

The entries in this section were not found in BCD on Friday, 8 November 2024, but are now present. These usually do not have any support information attached to them, and often have no corresponding MDN page. Sometimes, entries that appear here also appear in the next section (â€œRemoved BCD entriesâ€) because of a Working Group deciding on a rename.

API

  1. api â ServiceWorkerContainer â worker_support

Removed entries (3)

The entries in this section were found in BCD on Friday, 8 November 2024, but are no longer present. The reasons for this removal can be anything from an experimental proposal that was never supported to a property or value being renamed to something else.

CSS

  1. css â selectors â blank
  2. css â selectors â column

HTTP

  1. http â headers â Sec-CH-Save-Data

BCD Watch: A service of

Subscribe: RSS â€¢Â Atom â€¢Â JSON

This report was generated by diffing v5.6.14 (Friday, 8 November 2024) and v5.6.15 (Tuesday, 12 November 2024)

BCD Metadata Changes: 107

Show all 107 changes

Note: The following represent changes to BCD metadata keys in the reported time period. Keys are not implementations, and they don't represent commitments toward implementation, etc. A new key occurring is perhaps a signal that some implementer was serious enough to add the key. Many of the features that are 'removed' are usually just 'moved' or 'renamed', but we don't have great ways to highlight that.

Backfilled entries (50)

The entries in this section saw support information change since the report on Friday, 1 November 2024, but all the supported browser versions given were more than a couple of months old. Typically, these are cases of support information being updated long after the support actually landed in a browser, but nobody ever updated the BCD entry.

HTML

BCD Metadata Changes: 49

Show all 49 changes

Note: The following represent changes to BCD metadata keys in the reported time period. Keys are not implementations, and they don't represent commitments toward implementation, etc. A new key occurring is perhaps a signal that some implementer was serious enough to add the key. Many of the features that are 'removed' are usually just 'moved' or 'renamed', but we don't have great ways to highlight that.

Backfilled entries (16)

The entries in this section saw support information change since the report on Friday, 25 October 2024, but all the supported browser versions given were more than a couple of months old. Typically, these are cases of support information being updated long after the support actually landed in a browser, but nobody ever updated the BCD entry.
